title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 77.1 - General
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 77.1 - General

State Regulations

By section
400
of the

Transportation Law, as added by chapter 370 of the Laws of 1982, jurisdiction
over Stewart and Republic Airports was transferred to the Department of

Transportation from the Metropolitan Transportation Authority. Such section
provides that the Metropolitan Transportation Authority shall continue as the
operator of such airports for up to one year or until replaced by the
commissioner with another operator. The continuation of all rules and
regulations, acts, determinations and decisions of the Metropolitan

Transportation Authority with respect to the operation of Stewart and Republic

Airports is implied in chapter 370 of the Laws of 1982. However, to avoid any
confusion on this issue, the Department of Transportation hereby adopts, as

Department of Transportation rules and regulations, the rules and regulations, acts, determinations and decisions of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority
with respect to the ownership and operation of Stewart and Republic Airports, effective immediately. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
77.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
